instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: IM INJECTING VOLTAGE ON <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> AND WITH MY THERMAL CAMERA I CAN SEE THAT PCH IS GETTING WARM... IS THAT NORMAL BEHAVIOR WHEN INJECTING VOLTAGE? OR DOES IT MEANS THAT PCH IS DEAD?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Inject voltage why?
If there is low resistance, then bad PCH...

Please, don't use capital letters for entire post.
Don't you think is more easy to read the words with different letter size???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> resistance is 3 kohm. How can I find what is making the line pulse...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
What's the reason to inject voltage into 3K power rail?
You cannot get any information from that; voltage injection is used when detect short, or very low resistance to ground.

Can you tell us something more about this board?
Any history available, what is the symptom?
